section.p: In a default Red Hat Enterprise Linux installation, the following security precautions are taken:

ul.li: A firewall exists to prevent unauthorized user access.
Security-Enhanced Linux (SELinux), a security module that adds mandatory access control mechanisms to the Linux kernel, is enabled.

section.p: Before installing , make sure that the firewall is enabled and SELinux is running. Make sure that neither the firewall nor SELinux block the communication between the Control Machine and the remote machines.
The installation of opens the following ports:
Port 8081 is required internally by the Monitoring API, for example, for healthchecks or threads.
uses the following ports to integrate with the required OpenStack services:

ul.li: Port 80 for the OpenStack Horizon service.
Port 5000 and 35357 for the OpenStack Keystone service.

section.p: If it is necessary to manually enable access to the ports, you can execute the following commands. Repeat them for each port to which access must be enabled.
section.codeblock:
firewall-cmd --add-port=<port_number>/tcp firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=<port_number>/tcp firewall-cmd --reload
firewall-cmd --add-port=<port_number>/udp firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=<port_number>/udp firewall-cmd --reload
